programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: The week from oceans to mountains we follow the paths of animal migrations. We start in Hawaii as Philippe joins a humpback whale research team to get up close and in the water with these majestic animals that swim thousands of miles each year to and from Alaska. Then it's into the rocky mountains to see how Jackson, Wyoming accommodates thousands of elk that migrate to this area each winter.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: See how we can save our planet. We start at the Karen Beasley Sea Turtle Rescue and Rehabilitation center in North Carolina as Philippe gets a tour of this incredible facility. We then head to the beach where dozens of sea turtles are released back into the wild. In the Pacific Ocean, Trilogy Excursions leads regular coral reef cleaning to preserve the ecosystems there.

programme.title: World Series of Poker

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Brekstyn Schutten holds the lead in Event #4 over the final six players as $189,800 awaits the winner. Trailing Schutten are Chad Eveslage, Nick Petrangelo, Sam Soverel, Elio Fox, and Brock Wilson.

programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Dominique Witten: Stop Me When I'm Lying!
programme.desc: The stand up comic, actress, and “Chappelle's Show" performer gives her signature hot takes regarding the life and times of a modern comedian.

programme.title: Al Jackson: Baby Steps in a Yellow Tuxedo
programme.desc: Al Jackson hilariously navigates us through the life lesson that no matter how many times you stumble along the way, you can always do it with class.

programme.title: Damon Sumner: I'm a Professional
programme.desc: In his debut special, Damon Sumner hilariously dives into his inability to maintain a social life, raising both his kids and those of others and maintaining friendships as a couple at The Limelight Theater in Atlanta, Ga.

programme.title: Dino Archie: Toxic But Safe
programme.desc: Dino Archie's newest hour of comedy is the most beloved, toxic special of the year.

programme.title: J-L Cauvin: Half Blackface
programme.desc: Comedian J-L Cauvin hilariously addresses growing up the son of interracial parents and how the COVID-19 pandemic became his superhero origin story.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Marina Franklin: Single Black Female
programme.desc: Hilarious Chicago comedian Marina Franklin unpacks what it means to be ‘woke’ in the new world, dating younger, and relationship fumbles.

programme.title: Ian Abramson: The Heist
programme.desc: Comedian Ian Abramson mixes performance art and stand-up to create one of history's most bananas comedy specials.

programme.title: Arnez J.: Racially Motivated
programme.desc: Tackling everything from race relations to family life to hilarious impersonations, Arnez J is laugh-out-loud funny in his one-hour special.

programme.title: Bengt Washburn: Poking a Grizzly
programme.desc: Bengt Washburn performs standup.

programme.title: Cocoa Brown: Famous Enough
programme.desc: The comedian, actress and writer takes a live audience on her rollercoaster ride of dating and parenting during the pandemic—as only she can.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: Freezing Hot
programme.desc: The acclaimed Last Comic Standing winner explains how women hate being cold, but love cold weather, and other hilarious observations.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Bill Engvall: Here's Your Sign It's Finally Time My Last Show
programme.desc: After spending over four decades delighting audiences, the renowned comedian takes the stage for the last time in his farewell stand-up special.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.desc: Flip Wilson does stand-up, Pat Boone talks about the Olympics and a doctor waxes poetic on spanking children.

programme.desc: Richard Pryor discusses his recent trip to Zimbabwe and daily life since quitting drugs and alcohol.

programme.desc: Tim Conway and Steve Lawrence guest star!

programme.desc: Harvey and Tim are tipsy friends coming home from a night of carousing, plus a spoof of The Arabian Nights.

programme.desc: Martha Raye and Betty Grable guest in the soap opera spoof "As The Stomach Turns."

programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: A woman is killed in a drunk driving accident. At first, her death seems to be an open-and-shut case, but Dr. G discovers clues that the woman may have played a key role in her own death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After driving to his parent's house, Cameron Walker finds his dad dead in bed, and his mom bound in the closet.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: As each lead turns cold in a gruesome murder case, Dr. G worries justice may never be served. As the autopsy draws to a end, Dr. G uncovers a shocking clue that may solve this crime.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In an unprecedented double autopsy, Dr. G is determined to find out who is accountable for these odd deaths and solve the mystery of a love triangle gone awry.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hiker stumbles across a man's dead body in the woods. The victim's brother is convinced he was murdered. Dr. G must get to the bottom of this case. Was foul play really involved?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 45-year-old Natalie, who's visiting her sister from Australia, is found dead the morning after a heated argument with her estranged brother-in-law. Dr. G suspects foul play and she must race against the clock to give the police and Natalie's family the answers they need.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After suffering an apparent seizure, 37-year-old Ruben Delgado is found lifeless by his girlfriend.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor opens a nurse's chest and takes her heart in his hand in a desperate effort to save her life.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A newlywed's hand gets stuck in an appliance and a woman appears to only have blood flow to half of her brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An entire fraternity is plagued with blue urine, a pregnant woman is bitten by a spider and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman who inhaled toxic fumes now believes her neighbors want to kill her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends the ER staff on a wild-goose chase around the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled through the skull with a crowbar, a woman has an internal worm infection and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A six-year-old boy suffers a life-threatening stroke. A man has a camp stove stuck on his privates.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An urgent care physician must invent creative ways to save a choking child.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen football player suffers a stroke; a doctor remembers his first major trauma in the 1970s; a doctor tries to figure out what causes a patient's abdominal pain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors join their impaled patients for a few rounds of How Did That Get There.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two skydivers are rushed in, a bride-to-be gets her finger stuck in a make-up jar and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor treats three gunshot victims, a new doctor must perform emergency brain surgery and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is shot in the abdomen, a doctor is the victim of a car burglary and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient comes in with progressing paralysis, a boy is crushed by an ATV and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unresponsive golfer needs immediate surgery, three near-naked adults wreak havoc in the ER and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young man has a 2-inch pipe through his head. A young bride is bleeding uncontrollably.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A deranged cowboy is drenched in sweat, saliva and urine. No one knows why.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends the ER staff on a wild-goose chase around the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen football player suffers a stroke; a doctor remembers his first major trauma in the 1970s; a doctor tries to figure out what causes a patient's abdominal pain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A Halloween zombie with a problem below the belt mystifies doctors.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A disoriented young woman in a bunny costume checks into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman stops eating as she believes she is dead, a runner goes blind in one eye during a marathon and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surfer is impaled between the legs by the fin of his surfboard.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors use a robot operated by a specialist at another hospital to treat a seizing 7-year-old boy.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two seemingly unrelated gunshot wounds lead to a bizarre night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An off-duty ER physician diagnoses his own critical illness while en route to the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER nurse brings her delirious husband to the ER, then notices that his breath smells like mothballs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors struggle to save a young man brought to the ER frozen and pulseless.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A violent convict may be faking paralysis as part of a prison escape plan.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: From extraordinary challenges to outrageous predicaments, nurses tell true medical stories from their unique perspectives.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an engagement ring, a body builder can't breathe and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man itching from poison oak exposure turns out to also have maggots burrowing into an injury on his back.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in the abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pianist's finger is accidentally sawed off, a man's pacemaker is killing him yet keeping him alive and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three emergency deliveries in the ER cause a turf war, gunshot victims have a surprising connection and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teenage girl is impaled through the neck on an iron fence; a patient is convinced he's turning into a vampire; a first-year attending physician stands up to a room full of senior specialists to save the life of a critically ill pregnant woman.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in the final stretch of completing the South America Upland Slam. Having already checked off nine species in Argentina, he now finds himself in Peru, where he faces the challenge of tracking down two elusive species to complete his list: the Andean Tinamou and the Western Peruvian Dove.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Continuing on with his quest for The North America Deer Slam, Mark Peterson packs his Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle for a hunt in Mexico targeting the elusive Mexican Texanus Whitetail from elevated blinds. The outfitter here has done an amazing job managing the deer numbers and age groups to grow giant whitetails. Mark is anticipating the pre-rut will get these big bucks moving.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: The Missouri River Breaks of Montana is an amazing place to hunt elk that we are no stranger to. Nate & Clayton both drew tags and couldn’t wait to get to Flatwillow Creek Outfitters for what would be Clayton’s first elk hunt in almost 20 years.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade, Ryan and Bearcub take on the midwest! After some tough hunting, the group is able to make a move to get in position on a BIG midwestern gobbler! Bearcub was able to harvest him after working the bird for almost 45 minutes! Slade and Ryan also do some Pre-Deer season work, and establish where the fall food-plots will be!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade talks about some of the things he does to getready for the October 1st bow season opener in Mississippi, and weshow a couple doe hunts from thefirst couple days of the season.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: The Savage 110 Ultralite Elite is a lightweight, compact rifle that's ideal for backcountry hunters. This rifle cuts weight with features such as a Proof Research carbon-fiber wrapped stainless-steel barrel and MDT HNT26 folding carbon-fiber stock.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: We are closing out hunting season by going to Iowa for a late season gun hunt with our good friends Cole and Mackenzie Herb. Iowa is a magical place where whitetail hunters' dreams can come true and in this episode, Jerry finds himself back in this coveted state chasing some monster bucks with Cole.

programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair fishes the flats of the Florida Space Coast with Capt. Jon Lulay.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: Capt. Jason Dozier and Janot take a break from the guided trips, and take themselves on a hunting adventure.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew FINALLY make it to the Bahamas and the incredible Green Turtle Club for a week of fishing, diving, and exploring the Abaco Island chain. With two incredible boats at our disposal, we make the 200 mile crossings from Miami and Cape Canaveral to rendezvous at Green Turtle Cay. Stay tuned for Part one of our Bahamas adventure!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared travels to Venice, Louisiana, where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf, joining Capt. Garrett George and Capt. Jesse Leboeuf for an action-packed offshore adventure in pursuit of Redfish and Tuna.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared travels to Venice, Louisiana, where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf, joining Capt. Garrett George and Capt. Jesse Leboeuf for an action-packed offshore adventure in pursuit of Redfish and Tuna.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a look into enhanced storage and utility options from Boat Outfitters like cooler slides, tackle storage and CoolerWebs . They also tackle applying Tuff-coat paint to the Aquasport project and showcase how easy it is to apply.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: A day of reef fishing in Islamorada turns into a Kingfish and Yellowtail frenzy for Captains Scott and Steve.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: It only takes 3 fish to fill the Yeti cooler when Capt Scott fishes the top with kites for Wahoo and Steve pulls a big Mutton Snapper off the bottom.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take a long run into the Gulf from Stock Island and load thecoolers with Cobia and huge Yellowtail Snapper.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve head west from Key West to battle with big kingfish and end up with plenty of meat for the smoker.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve head out early out of Key West, Scott picks away at theYellowtail Snapper while Steve plays around with Cero Mackerel on fly.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve catch Bonitas for bait and slow troll them around wrecks for Wahoo and Kingfish.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew takes you to Alberta for an epic Canada Duck Hunt. Watch as Chad Belding and his crew scout and hunt dry field mallards.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in the final stretch of completing the South America Upland Slam. Having already checked off nine species in Argentina, he now finds himself in Peru, where he faces the challenge of tracking down two elusive species to complete his list: the Andean Tinamou and the Western Peruvian Dove.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Continuing on with his quest for The North America Deer Slam, Mark Peterson packs his Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle for a hunt in Mexico targeting the elusive Mexican Texanus Whitetail from elevated blinds. The outfitter here has done an amazing job managing the deer numbers and age groups to grow giant whitetails. Mark is anticipating the pre-rut will get these big bucks moving.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: The Missouri River Breaks of Montana is an amazing place to hunt elk that we are no stranger to. Nate & Clayton both drew tags and couldn’t wait to get to Flatwillow Creek Outfitters for what would be Clayton’s first elk hunt in almost 20 years.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade, Ryan and Bearcub take on the midwest! After some tough hunting, the group is able to make a move to get in position on a BIG midwestern gobbler! Bearcub was able to harvest him after working the bird for almost 45 minutes! Slade and Ryan also do some Pre-Deer season work, and establish where the fall food-plots will be!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew FINALLY make it to the Bahamas and the incredible Green Turtle Club for a week of fishing, diving, and exploring the Abaco Island chain. With two incredible boats at our disposal, we make the 200 mile crossings from Miami and Cape Canaveral to rendezvous at Green Turtle Cay. Stay tuned for Part one of our Bahamas adventure!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Colombiana
programme.desc: An orphaned girl grows up to become a professional assassin working for her uncle, always hoping to hunt down the mobster behind her parents’ deaths.

programme.desc: True story of a cocky Austrian mountain climber who escapes an Indian prison camp during WWII and goes to Tibet where he befriends the Dalai Lama.

programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: A River Runs Through It
programme.desc: The hit film version of the bestselling book about a Montana family and the relationship between two brothers with completely different personalities.

programme.title: Thunderheart
programme.desc: A part-Native American FBI agent's life is in danger when he discovers a conspiracy to frame an activist for a murder on indigenous land.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Mountain Men
programme.desc: Two old-time Wyoming fur trappers (Charlton Heston, Brian Keith) try to protect a runaway Indian (Victoria Racimo) from her angry ex-mate.

programme.title: Racing Luck
programme.desc: Brother-and-sister owners (Gloria Henry, Stanley Clements) discover their racehorses will only run if together.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Blazing the Western Trail
programme.desc: Noble cowboy the Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) gets snared in a vicious feud between two warring stagecoach operations. One of the two has been recently willed to spitfire Mary Halliday (Carole Mathews), whose father the Kid suspects was murdered by a business rival. With the help of his trusted friends Tex Harding (Tex Harding) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor), the Kid hopes to uncover the truth while hiding the investigation from the strident Miss Halliday.

programme.title: Smoky Canyon
programme.desc: The masked Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) settles a feud between cattlemen and sheepmen.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Coins For Love
programme.desc: In the sequel to “Coins for Christmas” Madison and Alec are reunited with new careers and new challenges that lead them to work together once again. Things start to heat up between the two, but their exes attempt to derail this budding romance.

programme.title: Coins Forever
programme.desc: Flourishing in their careers, Madison and Alec begin to explore their romance. However, reality strikes as the two face new distractions and obstacles that threaten to derail the fate of their relationship.

programme.title: Behind The Movement
programme.desc: A unique and fast paced retelling of how Rosa Parks refusal to give up her seat launched the history making Montgomery Bus Boycott. This ticking clock styled film recounts the inner workings and the behind the scenes preparation that took place in three intense days to pull the most successful boycott of it's time.

programme.desc: Surrounded by conflict at an early age, Lamar Odom found refuge in basketball. A near-death experiences and high-profile, tumultuous relationships skyrocketed Lamar’s fame, an affinity for partying tarnished his remarkable career.

programme.title: Uncensored
programme.desc: Actress and comedian, Niecy Nash is no stranger to rejection - therefore, she's learned a few lessons about what it takes to have perseverance in entertainment. With a Hollywood career spanning nearly three decades, Niecy Nash has finally arrived.

programme.title: UNSUNG: The Music and the Movement
programme.desc: Music and the Movement: �The Struggle� traces Black music from field hollers to R&B, showing how artists like Billie Holiday, Aretha Franklin, and Gil Scott-Heron used song to fuel social justice alongside Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

programme.title: UNSUNG: The Music and the Movement

programme.title: UNSUNG: The Music and the Movement
programme.desc: Music and the Movement "The Reckoning" examines the role of hip hop through four decades and its relationship to efforts to achieve social justice, from �80s era anthems like �The Message� and �Fight the Power� to a wave of songs by up and coming artists in the wake of George Floyd�s death.

programme.title: White Water
programme.desc: White Water is the story of a 7 year-old black kid in segregated 1963 Opelika, Alabama who becomes obsessed with the desire to taste the water from the "white's only" drinking fountain and sets out on a quest to do the unthinkable: drink from it.

programme.title: Coins For Love
programme.desc: In the sequel to “Coins for Christmas” Madison and Alec are reunited with new careers and new challenges that lead them to work together once again. Things start to heat up between the two, but their exes attempt to derail this budding romance.

programme.title: Coins Forever
programme.desc: Flourishing in their careers, Madison and Alec begin to explore their romance. However, reality strikes as the two face new distractions and obstacles that threaten to derail the fate of their relationship.

programme.title: Behind The Movement
programme.desc: A unique and fast paced retelling of how Rosa Parks refusal to give up her seat launched the history making Montgomery Bus Boycott. This ticking clock styled film recounts the inner workings and the behind the scenes preparation that took place in three intense days to pull the most successful boycott of it's time.

programme.title: Runaway Island
programme.desc: A diverse group of guests at a tropical island resort find their lives intersecting when a hurricane strikes, forcing them to bond as they seek refuge.

programme.title: Unsung
programme.desc: Christopher Williams, a singer and actor from the Bronx, emerged during the late 1980s with a string of new jack swing hits and a pretty boy look. But scandals and arrests would derail his career.

programme.desc: Finding happiness has been a journey for Paula Patton, and while experiencing love and heartbreak in the public eye hasn't been easy, motherhood, despite it all, is the perfect snapshot of Paula's life, undoubtedly becoming her best role yet.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: On this hour-long episode Danny is doubly-blessed when a His and Hers restoration--a 1970 Plymouth Road Runner and a 1970 Dodge Coronet--are commissioned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny conspires with a proud dad to give the ultimate surprise 16th birthday gift, and the shop frustrates a customer with a design error.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick races to nab a 1959 go-kart; a collection of toys from "Jurassic Park" comes roaring into the shop; Rick and Chum head to the east coast to check out an 18th century cannon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Spencer drops into the shop with some tasty new finds, but will Rick bite? Then, Chum and Rick disappear from the shop to meet up with a magician selling a zig zag box. Can they conjure up an offer? Meanwhile, Corey finds himself flustered over a pricey gold necklace made of ancient coins. And later, Chum tries to script the perfect deal for a collection of Hollywood items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller Super Bowl shuffles into the shop with a helmet and football signed by Da Bears; Chum strikes a jumpman pose as he checks out a bronze Michael Jordan statue; Corey says hello to a replica 1963 Cadillac from the movie "Scarface."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out the only 1933 Double Eagle gold coin for sale; Chum visits Disneyland with a miniature model of Main Street USA; Corey hopes for a big bang when he investigates a tiny Japanese matchlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, Chum and a host of colleagues from the shop remember Richard Benjamin Harrison, "the Old Man," in some of the best moments over a decade of funny jabs, odd sayings, fierce negotiations and great buys.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: All engines rev when Corey flips a limited-edition Dodge Demon; a vintage suit worn by the legendary Dale Earnhardt Sr. sends Corey and Chumlee racing.
